definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
vulture/(bird species of China) cinereous vulture (Aegypius monachus)
vulture/(bird species of China) griffon vulture (Gyps fulvus)
(bird species of China) Egyptian vulture (Neophron percnopterus)
(bird species of China) white-rumped vulture (Gyps bengalensis)
(bird species of China) bearded vulture (Gypaetus barbatus)
(bird species of China) Himalayan vulture (Gyps himalayensis)
(bird species of China) red-headed vulture (Sarcogyps calvus)

sentences.english: The eagle that soars in the upper air does not worry itself as to how it is to cross rivers. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 高飞天空的鹫鹰，从不挂虑它将怎样渡过江河。

sentences.english: Turkey vultures ranging over the rain forests of South America can't see their food either.
sentences.chinese: 盘旋于南美雨林上空的美洲鹫也无法看见猎物。

sentences.english: Golden eagles use air currents to soar and may glide up to 15 miles at a stretch.
sentences.chinese: 鹫使用气流来滑翔，并且一次能滑翔15英里。

sentences.english: " Elegy of a Hero": What fate awaits this captured gray-faced buzzard eagle?
sentences.chinese: 被捕的灰面鹫会有什么遭遇？

definition: a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
wild beast/wild horse/lion/trad. form used erroneously for 貌/simplified form used erroneously for 狻
